areaSection: Calpe is one of the Costa Blanca's most distinctive and sophisticated coastal municipalities, characterised by its dramatic geography dominated by the iconic Peñón d'Ifach rock formation. Situated in the province of Alicante, approximately 40 kilometres north of Benidorm, Calpe offers a perfect balance between cosmopolitan amenity and authentic Spanish character. The area benefits from a Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of sunshine annually, temperate winters, and refreshing sea breezes that moderate summer temperatures. The municipality has evolved from a fishing village into an upscale residential destination while maintaining its authentic charm. Calpe's position on the coast provides direct access to pristine beaches, while its proximity to mountain terrain offers dramatic natural landscapes. The town is particularly favoured by discerning international buyers who appreciate its blend of natural beauty, quality infrastructure, and cultural sophistication.
lifestyleSection: Living in Calpe means embracing a Mediterranean lifestyle characterised by exceptional quality of life and authentic cultural experiences. The town attracts a sophisticated expatriate community, particularly British and German residents, creating an international environment where English is widely spoken. Daily life revolves around access to Blue Flag beaches including Arenal-Bol and Cantal Roig, complemented by numerous beachfront restaurants and tapas bars serving fresh Mediterranean cuisine. The expat community has established excellent infrastructure, with English-speaking professionals across healthcare, education, and service industries. Calpe offers refined shopping experiences at modern supermarkets including Mercadona and Mas y Mas, alongside traditional weekly markets showcasing local produce. For sports enthusiasts, Club de Golf Ifach is just 5 minutes away, offering championship-standard facilities. The town maintains a relaxed pace while providing all contemporary conveniences, making it ideal for those seeking work-life balance. Healthcare facilities include the nearby Hospital de Dénia and numerous private clinics with English-speaking staff, ensuring peace of mind for international residents.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment opportunity within a market demonstrating robust fundamentals. Calpe's property market has appreciated 7% year-on-year, reflecting sustained demand from international buyers seeking quality Mediterranean real estate. The property's positioning in Gran Sol, combined with competitive pricing at €925,000, offers entry-level pricing for a 3-bedroom villa in this prestigious location. Rental potential is particularly attractive, with comparable properties commanding approximately €1,000 per week during peak season, translating to €52,000 annually from short-term holiday lets. Long-term rental yields remain solid at 4-5% across the Calpe market. The region benefits from consistent tourism demand, particularly from Northern European visitors seeking winter sun and beach access. Property appreciation has outpaced many European markets, while costs remain significantly lower than Jávea and other established Costa Blanca hotspots - approximately 20% below premium neighbouring areas. For investors seeking diversified property holdings or holiday home ownership with income generation, Calpe offers an increasingly attractive proposition within Spain's property market.

At €925,000, the property offers competitive pricing for one of Calpe's most prestigious addresses, combining architectural quality, natural beauty, and strategic positioning near beaches, golf, and international amenities. healthcare.text: Healthcare provision in and around Calpe meets international standards with excellent facilities catering specifically to expatriate populations. Hospital de Dénia, located 30 minutes away, is a modern facility offering comprehensive acute and specialist services. Locally, Centro de Salud Calp provides primary care and routine medical services, while numerous private clinics throughout Calpe employ English-speaking doctors and specialist practitioners. Pharmacies are conveniently located throughout the town, with staff trained in English-language consultation. Emergency ambulance services are highly responsive, and international health insurance is widely accepted. Many expatriate residents maintain private health insurance, ensuring rapid access to consultant-led care and specialist treatments.

shopping.text: Shopping and provisioning in Calpe cater to diverse preferences and budgets through a combination of modern supermarkets and traditional Spanish markets. transport.text: Transportation infrastructure in Calpe facilitates convenient movement throughout the region and beyond. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's fourth-largest international hub, is approximately 75 kilometres (1 hour's drive) away, offering direct connections to most European destinations. Bus services connect Calpe to Benidorm, Valencia, and surrounding municipalities, providing regular public transport options. The Costa Blanca TRAM system is expanding into the Calpe area, which will enhance regional connectivity when completed. For daily mobility, car ownership is practical given Spain's excellent road infrastructure and abundant parking. The town's compact centre is pedestrian-friendly, with most restaurants, shops, and services within walking distance. Taxis and local transport options provide alternatives for those preferring not to drive.
